contents: Article 37 (Disciplinary Surcharge) ① When the committee (including the category committee and city/provincial committee) decides on disciplinary action in accordance with Article 33, if the reason for the disciplinary action is receiving money or entertainment, embezzlement or misappropriation of public funds, etc. In addition to the relevant disciplinary action, a decision may be made to impose a disciplinary surcharge up to 5 times the amount of money or entertainment received, the amount of embezzlement or misappropriation of public funds, etc. In this case, the relevant organization shall submit a decision in Form No. 3 to the person suspected of disciplinary action and his/her affiliated organization. The head must be notified. ② If the committee makes a decision pursuant to paragraph 1, the head of the relevant organization shall collect additional disciplinary fees in accordance with the standards for imposing disciplinary surcharges in Appendix 3. ③ Before the committee makes a decision pursuant to paragraph 1, the person suspected of disciplinary action is subject to criminal punishment under other laws for receiving money or entertainment, embezzlement or misappropriation of public funds, or is liable for compensation (including cases where he or she is subject to confiscation or additional collection). ) In this case, the total amount of fines, compensation, confiscation or additional fines and disciplinary surcharges shall not exceed five times the amount of money and entertainment received and the amount of embezzlement or misappropriation of public funds. ④ The committee must decide on a reduction in disciplinary surcharges within 30 days from the date on which any of the following reasons arise, and in this case, the relevant organization shall immediately send a decision on reduction of disciplinary surcharges in Form No. 4 to the person suspected of disciplinary action and his/her affiliated organization. The chairman must be notified. However, this does not apply if the person suspected of disciplinary action refuses to receive it. 1. When a person who has received a decision to impose a disciplinary surcharge applies to the committee for a resolution to reduce the disciplinary surcharge within 60 days from the date the court's judgment (including judgment on confiscation and collection) becomes final or the responsibility for compensation, etc. is fulfilled 2. If the Committee learns that the court's decision (including judgments on confiscation and collection) against a person who has been decided to impose a disciplinary surcharge has been confirmed or that the responsibility for compensation, etc. has been fulfilled, ⑤ It may decide to reduce the disciplinary surcharge in accordance with paragraph 4. In this case, the committee must decide to reduce or reduce the total amount of fines, compensation, confiscation or additional fines and disciplinary additional charges to the extent that the total amount does not exceed five times the amount of money or entertainment received or the amount of embezzlement or misappropriation of public funds. ⑥ In cases where it is difficult to apply paragraph 3 or 5 because a person suspected of disciplinary action or a person on whom a disciplinary additional fine has been decided is sentenced to a punishment other than a fine (including cases where a fine is imposed concurrently), the Committee shall determine the type of punishment, the amount of punishment, and The disciplinary surcharge must be adjusted or reduced by comprehensively considering whether the sentence is imprisonment, probation, or suspended sentence.
